intro: Hibbertia stricta var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-hairied hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. Hibbertia stricta var. leiocarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
